job_title: Language and Culture Assistant in Madrid
pros: I had an amazing experience teaching in Spain as a language and culture assistant. It was one of the most valuable experiences I've had. Living in a new country with a job is something only some will experience, but if you do, it opens so many doors.
cons: Advertised as 16 hours per week. Most schools are at least 1 hr away from city center, so you have to add travel time. My school had a 2 hour lunch break during which the assistants just sat around and waited for class to start. It was more like 30 hrs/week.

pros: Great experience and an awesome learning experience. cons: Program coordinator's don't check up on you often; if you need something you must reach out to them.
